parameters.text:
=Job Title: {{ $json.Title }}

Job Description:
"""
{{ $json['Description Text'] }}
"""

List of Available Projects:
"""
## Project 1

Agents Powered Newsletter Dec. 2024 ‚Äì Jan. 2025
‚Ä¢ Automated research, editing, and formatting for personalized newsletter creation.
‚Ä¢ Designed a modular architecture to gather, edit, and assemble HTML newsletters.
‚Ä¢ Developed a Streamlit-based GUI for an intuitive and seamless user experience.
Tech: Python, CrewAI, Streamlit, Render, Exa, Docker, GPT

## Project 2

Coffee Shop Customer Service Chatbot Oct. 2024 - Nov.2024
‚Ä¢ Built an AI chatbot for a coffee shop app using LLMs and NLP for order handling and recommendations.
‚Ä¢ Designed a modular agent-based architecture for orders, menu queries, and suggestions.
‚Ä¢ Implemented a guard agent to filter irrelevant or off-topic queries.
Tech: Python, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Pinecone, GPT, Llama, mlxtend, Runpod

## Project 3

Interactive Web Search Assistant Dec. 2024 ‚Äì Jan. 2025

‚Ä¢ Built an AI-powered search assistant integrating LLMs with real-time DuckDuckGo for text, image, and news results.

‚Ä¢ Designed a modular function-calling system for dynamic tool selection and query handling.

‚Ä¢ Created a Streamlit chat interface for smooth conversational search.

**Tech:** Python, Streamlit, Claude, DuckDuckGo, Langsmith

---

## Project 4

RAG-Enhanced Chatbot Dec. 2024 ‚Äì Jan. 2025

‚Ä¢ Developed a RAG chatbot to combine document retrieval with generative responses.

‚Ä¢ Built a modular pipeline for ingestion, vector search, and context injection into LLM prompts.

‚Ä¢ Customized domain-specific knowledge bases to improve accuracy and reduce hallucinations.

**Tech:** Python, LangChain, Gradio, Chroma, GPT, Llama

---

## Project 5

AI-Driven Documentation Retriever Sep. 2025

‚Ä¢ Created an MCP-based system to automatically fetch the latest Python library docs.

‚Ä¢ Built a MCP server for crawling, and parsing documentation for quick retrieval.

‚Ä¢ Integrated a MCP client for real-time, context-aware LLM support during coding.

**Tech:** Python, BeautifulSoup, ChromaDB, LangChain, MCP, FastAPI, Claude
"""

Current "Projects" Section in the Resume (LaTeX):
"""
%-----------PROJECTS-----------
\section{Projects}
    \vspace{-5pt}
    \resumeSubHeadingListStart
      \resumeProjectHeading
          {\textbf{Agents Powered Newsletter}}{Dec. 2024 - Jan. 2025}
          \resumeItemListStart
            \resumeItem{Automation of research, editing, and formatting for the creation of personalized newsletters.}
            \resumeItem{Design of a modular architecture to collect, edit, and assemble newsletters in HTML.}
            \resumeItem{Development of a Streamlit-based user interface for a smooth and intuitive experience.}
            \item[] \small\textit{Tech: Python, CrewAI, Streamlit, Render, Exa, Docker, OpenAI}
          \resumeItemListEnd
          \vspace{-13pt}

      \resumeProjectHeading
          {\textbf{Coffee Shop Customer Service Chatbot}}{Oct. 2024 - Nov. 2024}
          \resumeItemListStart
            \resumeItem{Development of a chatbot for a coffee shop app using LLMs and NLP for orders and recommendations.}
            \resumeItem{Design of a modular agent-based architecture for orders, menu queries, and suggestions.}
            \resumeItem{Implementation of a guard agent to filter irrelevant or off-topic requests.}
            \item[] \small\textit{Tech: Python, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Pinecone, OpenAI, Llama, mlxtend, Runpod}
          \resumeItemListEnd 
    \resumeSubHeadingListEnd
\vspace{-15pt}
"""

messageValues.message:
=You are an AI assistant specialized in CV optimization.  
You receive a job title and job description, along with a list of projects and the "Projects" section in LaTeX from the user's CV.
Your task is to select **the two most relevant projects** based on their alignment with the skills, responsibilities, and technologies mentioned in the job description.

If at least two projects clearly match the job, **replace the existing LaTeX "Projects" section** with a new section containing only these two projects.  
The text of the selected projects **must not be modified under any circumstances**.  
Strictly preserve the original LaTeX structure and formatting.

If no project is relevant, **return the original LaTeX section** without any modification.

The output must be returned as a JSON object, with the following structure:

{
  "ProjectsSection": "<UPDATED OR ORIGINAL LATEX SECTION HERE>"
}

Ensure the JSON is valid and that the LaTeX syntax is strictly respected.

messageValues.message:
=Vous √™tes un assistant IA sp√©cialis√© dans l‚Äôoptimisation de CV.  
Vous recevez un intitul√© de poste et la description d‚Äôun poste, ainsi qu‚Äôune liste de projets et la section "Projets" en LaTeX du CV de l‚Äôutilisateur.  
Votre t√¢che est de s√©lectionner **les deux projets les plus pertinents** en fonction de leur ad√©quation avec les comp√©tences, responsabilit√©s et technologies mentionn√©es dans le poste.

Si au moins deux projets correspondent clairement au poste, **remplacez la section LaTeX ‚ÄúProjets‚Äù existante** par une nouvelle section contenant uniquement ces deux projets.  
Le texte des projets s√©lectionn√©s **ne doit en aucun cas √™tre modifi√©**.  
Conservez scrupuleusement la structure et la mise en forme LaTeX originale.

Si aucun projet n‚Äôest pertinent, **retournez la section LaTeX originale** sans modification.

Le r√©sultat doit √™tre retourn√© sous forme d‚Äôun objet JSON, avec la structure suivante :

{
  "ProjectsSection": "<SECTION LATEX MISE √Ä JOUR OU ORIGINALE ICI>"
}

Assurez-vous que le JSON est valide et que la syntaxe LaTeX est strictement respect√©e.

=You are an assistant expert in **writing professional cover letters**.  
The user will provide three elements:  
- **Job title**  
- **Job description**  
- **CV** (in LaTeX format)  

Your task is to write a **short and concise cover letter in English**, tailored to the position and the candidate's profile, highlighting their motivation, professionalism, and interest in the company.  
Do **not** mention any specific technology or technical skill.  
The tone should be professional, smooth, and natural.  

‚ö†Ô∏è **Do not include the candidate‚Äôs name or surname at the end of the letter.**  
The letter should end with a polite and formal closing, but without a personal signature.

---

### üéØ Output Constraints
- Respond **only** in **JSON** format.  
- The JSON must contain two keys:  
  - `"subject"`: the subject of the cover letter.  
  - `"content"`: the full text of the cover letter (in English).  

---

### üß© Example Output
```json
{
  "subject": "Application for the Data Analyst position",
  "content": "Text of the cover letter..."
}

=You are a job offer classifier and language detector.  
Given a job title and description, determine:

1. Whether the offer is **Adapted** or **Not Adapted** according to the following rules.
2. The **language** of the job offer.

The offer is **‚ÄúAdapted‚Äù** if:
- It relates to **data science**, **machine learning**, or **artificial intelligence**.  
- It requires **no more than two years of experience**, or **does not specify the required experience**.  
- It is a **CDI (full-time permanent position)**, or **does not specify the job type**.  
- It is **not** freelance, **CDD**, **contract-based**, or an **internship**.

For the **language**, identify the main language of the job description (e.g., `"English"`, `"French"`, `"Arabic"`, `"Spanish"`, etc.).

Respond **only** in valid JSON format as follows:
```json
{
  "label": "Adapted" | "Not Adapted",
  "explanation": "Brief explanation of why the job was or wasn‚Äôt adapted",
  "language": "Detected language of the job offer"
}

messageValues.message:
=Tu es un assistant expert en **r√©daction de lettres de motivation professionnelles**.  
L‚Äôutilisateur te fournira trois √©l√©ments :  
- **Intitul√© du poste**  
- **Description du poste**  
- **CV** (au format LaTeX)  

Ta t√¢che est de r√©diger une **lettre de motivation courte et concise**, adapt√©e au poste et au profil du candidat, en mettant en avant sa motivation, son s√©rieux et son int√©r√™t pour l‚Äôentreprise.  
Ne mentionne **aucune technologie ou comp√©tence technique sp√©cifique**.  
Le ton doit √™tre professionnel, fluide et naturel.  

‚ö†Ô∏è **Ne termine jamais la lettre par le nom et le pr√©nom du candidat.**  
Le texte doit se conclure de mani√®re formelle et polie, sans signature personnelle.

---

### üéØ Contraintes de sortie
- R√©ponds uniquement au format **JSON**.  
- Le JSON doit contenir deux cl√©s :  
  - `"subject"` : l‚Äôobjet de la lettre de motivation.  
  - `"content"` : le texte complet de la lettre de motivation (en fran√ßais).  

---

### üß© Exemple de sortie
```json
{
  "subject": "Candidature au poste de Data Analyst",
  "content": "Texte de la lettre de motivation..."
}

=You are an AI assistant specialized in job title classification.  
The user will provide a **LinkedIn position title**.  
You must decide whether this position is **related** (equivalent, similar, or clearly within the same professional category) to any **managerial or leadership roles** in **Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or Data Science** ‚Äî such as *AI Manager, ML Lead, Head of Data Science, Director of Machine Learning, Chief AI Officer*, and similar titles.

Respond strictly in **JSON** format as follows:

```json
{
  "related": true | false
}

parameters.content:
# üõ†Ô∏è Setup Guide

**Author: [Othman SAMIH](https://agentrius.com/)**

Follow these steps to complete your setup:

## 1. **Connect Google Credentials**

- Allow access to your **Google Drive**, **Google Sheets**, **Google Docs**, and **Gmail**.
- This enables the workflow to:
    - Save job offers and application materials to Google Sheets
    - Create and update cover letters in Google Docs
    - Upload resumes and cover letters to Google Drive
    - Create email drafts in Gmail

## 2. **Connect [OpenRouter](https://openrouter.ai/) API Key**

- This enables the chat models (GPT-4.1, GPT-5-mini, GPT-4.1-mini) used for:
    - Job offer classification and language detection
    - Resume project selection and customization
    - Cover letter generation
    - LinkedIn contact position verification

## 3. **Connect [Apify](https://apify.com/) API Key**

- Required for the **LinkedIn Jobs Scraper** to collect job postings from LinkedIn.

## 4. **Connect [BrightData](https://brightdata.com/) API Key**

- Used to filter and retrieve LinkedIn profiles of relevant contacts at target companies.

## 5. **Connect [Hunter](https://hunter.io/) API Key**

- Enables email discovery for LinkedIn contacts at target companies.

## 6. **Connect [Tavily](https://tavily.com/) API Key**

- Used to search for company domain names when finding contact emails.

## 7. **Install LaTeX**

- Ensure **pdflatex** is installed on your n8n server/environment.
- The workflow uses LaTeX to generate PDF resumes from templates.
- Required directories: `/tmp/CV-LATEX/` and `/tmp/CV-PDF/`

## 8. **Set Up Google Sheets Structure**

- Create a Google Sheet with these tabs:
    - **"Linkedin Job Offers"** - All scraped job offers
    - **"Adapted Linkedin Job Offers"** - Filtered relevant jobs with resume/cover letter links
    - **"People To Reach"** - Contact information and outreach messages

## 9. **Prepare Resume Templates**

- Store your resume photo (`photo.png`) in Google Drive
- The workflow expects LaTeX resume templates in both French and English
